item.title: “In Mountains”

item.description:
In Mountains by Bottle Imp Productions The latest Bottle Imp sampler features the softer, more ambient side of our label. It features artists like AMNION and Mark Wardale.

item.title: AMNION, “Maelstrom”
item.description:
Maelstrom ties together ten years of generated analogue and digital noise into a dark and seething aural landscape of sonic density. In bringing his latest album to life Amnion reflects on the last decade of his practice, looking back to…

The post AMNION, “Maelstrom” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Maelstrom ties together ten years of generated analogue and digital noise into a dark and seething aural landscape of sonic density.

In bringing his latest album to life Amnion reflects on the last decade of his practice, looking back to where it began back in 2008 with his first digital release ‘EXP1’ on Bottle Imp. Maelstrom could easily be a follow up to his debut album with its combination of darkly warped tones and abstracted rhythmic noise.

The post AMNION, “Maelstrom” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: Mark Wardale, “Close”
item.description:
“Close,” by Mark Wardale (aka Rowboat) carries us on a dramatic journey overseeing a frozen paradise.With the first track, “Byrja,” we begin by taking our first careful steps upon stairs of piano keys, then climb violin strings to board our…

The post Mark Wardale, “Close” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
“Close,” by Mark Wardale (aka Rowboat) carries us on a dramatic journey overseeing a frozen paradise.
With the first track, “Byrja,” we begin by taking our first careful steps upon stairs of piano keys, then climb violin strings to board our horned ship of brass.
While riding the skies upon, “Veðráttufarsríma,” we hear our guide sing the lost story of our vessel in a voice both clear and waning.
We descend to the shores where the stoic tides are interrupted by, “Pebbles,” and surrender to the entropy of, “Óreiða.”
Our voyage ends with us wrapped in the gentle, “Sails,” that just moments before harnessed the full force of the arctic wind.
The musical craft that is the album, “Close,” gives us the perfect vantage point from which to view this world of clashing extremes and hushed tranquility. We experience swimming up waterfalls and climb mountains made of water. We build sandcastles of ash and study the light of prisms through the dark.
Wardale has crafted a narrative score that, like the voices of the unseen elves, charms and bewitches the listener and leads her to a magical world of chill beauty.

This album was written & recorded in Yorkshire, UK at Four Pillar Music©
Recorded Between March 2017 and July 2017.
Bottle Imp Productions 2018.
All Rights Reserved.

I would like to express my heartfelt gratitude to my family for all of your support, tolerance and patience. You are my world.

http://www.markwardale.co.uk/

Additional credits:
Art by Joshua McAllister
Vocals on ‘Veðráttufarsríma’ performed by Parmes Sigurjónsson.
Additional Thanks to Rósa Þorsteinsdóttir, Ísmús, Dan and Will.

The post Mark Wardale, “Close” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.content:encoded:

Vocal performance and composition by Elyse Reardon. All sound design, arrangements and mix downs provided by Daniel Tuttle.

item.title: Wayward Sun, “Casual Stoicism”
item.description:
Debut release by Wayward Sun. A series of sonic vignettes on the topic of grief. Tracks 1-11 loop seamlessly forever, track 12 provides a smooth transition to a conclusion. Performed and recorded by Scott Mitting. Mastered by R. Galbraith. Photography…

The post Wayward Sun, “Casual Stoicism” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Debut release by Wayward Sun. A series of sonic vignettes on the topic of grief. Tracks 1-11 loop seamlessly forever, track 12 provides a smooth transition to a conclusion.

Performed and recorded by Scott Mitting. Mastered by R. Galbraith. Photography by Mark Spybey. Layout by Daniel Tuttle. Released by Bottle Imp Productions in association with TV Live Entertainment. Dedicated to Kathy M Mitting 1954-2016.

It’s a suitably haunting collection of downtempo electronic instrumentals with vocals on two tracks.
AZCentral
Tweet
The dreamy atmosphere that pervades the album has moments of tension, but never without peaceable resolve… Casual Stoicism seems like a slow revelation of self and there is an innocence, a tender beauty, that overrides any of the darker sentiments in this ambient soup of sound.
YabYum Music + Arts
Tweet

The post Wayward Sun, “Casual Stoicism” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: in violet, “amber”
item.description:
The long-awaited followup to 2013’s debut ‘opal’, this album unveils in violet’s evolution through three years of development. ‘amber’ is a deeply personal record. Drawing inspiration from a strange mix of mythology and self-reflection these ten songs are darker, more…

The post in violet, “amber” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
The long-awaited followup to 2013’s debut ‘opal’, this album unveils in violet’s evolution through three years of development. ‘amber’ is a deeply personal record. Drawing inspiration from a strange mix of mythology and self-reflection these ten songs are darker, more electronically-driven and focused than before, with recurrent musical and lyrical themes threading throughout the 60-minute journey. Sonic manipulation and distortion damage then redefine familiar sounds, warping perception into something more surreal. Best played in a single sitting, in darkness, it’s not a journey for the faint of heart and with repeated listening & immersion drawing out new details to discover in every sitting.

All songs written, recorded, mixed and produced by Jake Murray, except where noted.

Mastered by Arthur Young at Shaken Oak Studios.

Assistant engineers: Matias Duarte, Adrian Furdui, Niclas Jeppsson, Timor Shait.

The post in violet, “amber” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: Shadowjack, “Pathfinder Chapter 1”
item.description:
Pathfinder pushes forward and develops the ambient and cinematic atmospherics established on First Bloom. Chapter 1 is the beginning in a multi-part journey through the universe and beyond. Recorded and mastered at 48k/24-bit. Includes bonus 3440 × 1440 px Ultra-Wide…

The post Shadowjack, “Pathfinder Chapter 1” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Pathfinder pushes forward and develops the ambient and cinematic atmospherics established on First Bloom. Chapter 1 is the beginning in a multi-part journey through the universe and beyond. Recorded and mastered at 48k/24-bit. Includes bonus 3440 × 1440 px Ultra-Wide desktop wallpaper

Shirts also available

The post Shadowjack, “Pathfinder Chapter 1” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
